Params: {1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory812.jpg'}
{3: "Nighttime, in the Craftsman's workshop."}
{1: '1', 3: 'A shadowy figure appears behind the Craftsman.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'What are you doing?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: "Hmm... I'm watching the stars.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: "This isn't a metaphor or anything; I'm literally just watching the stars.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The Craftsman is adjusting an old optical telescope, seemingly cobbled together from whatever materials she could find.'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'With such a... primitive tool?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'In the history of many civilizations, these were the first eyes gazing into the cosmos.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: "It's simple, crude... but fascinating.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'You can only see a silhouette of the universe.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'Just a silhouette, but it\'s enough to mark a "beginning."', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'Don\'t you think we\'ve reached the "end" long ago?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: '"End" and "beginning" are just two knots on the same string for us.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: "From here to there, from there to here, it's all the same.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'So, how do we define which is the "beginning" and which is the "end"?', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'In a way, "starry sky" is such a narrow yet expansive concept.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'Stars are like mirrors, reflecting the eyes that gaze upon them.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'This one, that one... and that one over there, what are they called in your world?', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'Ursa Major alpha, beta, and gamma.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: "Ursa Major... So it's named after the shape it forms?", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: "Pfft, haha... really? That's quite amusing.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: "Here, they remain unnamed, but I suppose it's only a matter of time.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'Even with different "beginnings," the "end" we reach will not change.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'If we follow your analogy, that would be a dead end.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'Perhaps.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'You seem quite fond of this "planet."', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'I suppose? The patterns of its basic particles are fascinating, and they easily entangle.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: "It's like a gacha machine; even if you know what's inside, you still look forward to what the next shake will bring.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'Sometimes it does bring a bit of "trouble" though...', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'Her "drifting" this far is somewhat of a "miracle."', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'Yeah, and it has added to my workload.', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'But now I\'m just speaking for "me."', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'Would you like me to help?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: 'Are you always this eager to help?', 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'Like you said, just fixing some minor "errors."', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: "No need, I've solved most of the issues. The rest... I think it's okay to leave them as they are.", 4: '2'}
{1: '1', 2: '???', 3: 'Do you think doing so will give birth to "unknowns"?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Craftsman', 3: "That's what we crave the most, isn't it?", 4: '2'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory232.png'}
{1: 'Babylonia', 2: 'Science Council Section 1'}
{3: 'The blue-haired Construct removes her connector and sits up from the experience pod.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'How does it feel, Lesti?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: "I think it's fine.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'The external readings show no anomalies, and based on the materials you submitted earlier, I believe the risk of safety hazards is negligible.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'With this, the Control Court\'s work is essentially done. Given the precedent set by "Hamlet", the document approval should be quick.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'What do you think, Miss Leonie?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Ishmael offers a polite smile, inquiring of the technician from the World Government Association of Art beside her.'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The girl known as "Leonie", who had been idly observing the bustling researchers in the lab, snaps back to reality at the sound of her name.'}
{2: 'Leonie', 3: 'Ah... um, sorry, I was a bit lost in thought.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Leonie', 3: "So, the machine is fine? Phew... that's a relief. I thought we were going to encounter another bizarre issue.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: "Miss Leonie, let's set this aside for the moment. We've clearly marked the issues with your previously rejected technical applications.", 4: '1'}

{2: 'Lesti', 3: 'For instance, your last proposal for a "Giant Space Combat Humanoid Mecha with a Single-Pilot Cockpit"... How could we possibly approve your request to use the Engineering Force\'s resources for something like that?!', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Lesti', 3: "And your applications manage to overflow the Science Council and Engineering Force's mailboxes every month; the Control Court has received complaints from them more than once.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lesti', 3: 'Though unrelated to this review, I suggest you consider the feasibility of your projects more carefully next time you write an application!', 4: '1'}
{3: 'The typically jovial Lesti takes on a rare serious tone, highlighting just how much of a nuisance Leonie can be for the Control Court, which is responsible for reviewing all matters.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: "Sigh... your words sound exactly like those old fogeys from the Council, always saying no to this and that, like they're allergic to anything interesting.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: "Old, old fogeys...?! I'm merely—", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Hehe, I've heard our Chief Technician mention that Miss Leonie was quite the maverick even during her time in Science Council Section 2.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'What are you doing here?', 4: '1'}
{3: "A young man in a sleek lab coat steps through the door, only to find that his path to his own laboratory is blocked by three people who don't belong there."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: "Quack... It's Asimov.", 4: '1'}
{3: "Seeing Asimov's face, Leonie's expression shifts dramatically as if she swallowed a duck."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Why are people from the Control Court here?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: "Hmm? Strange, didn't you get notified?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Just some minor work, it's already wrapped up.", 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: 'Miss Leonie submitted an inspection request for the subsequent models of the "Hamlet" theater play machine. We\'re just here to check for any potential technical and safety hazards.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: '"Hamlet"... I remember someone telling me that the World Government Association of Art wanted to take back its maintenance work. So, that was for this.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'The original technology of "Hamlet" is a relic from the Golden Age. Although the Science Council was in charge of maintenance, they didn\'t have the spare capacity to restore the technology. It\'s essentially a "black box."', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'If the World Government Association of Art is willing to take over, it would be a good thing.', 4: '1'}

{2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Perhaps it could even contribute to the technology of remote connection for Constructs. Once the Association has finished analyzing it, remember to submit a technical report to Section 1.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: 'Wait! Why should I work for you for free?!', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Sharing results is a fundamental rule that all departments with the capability for technological research in Babylonia must follow.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: "But I've never seen the Science Council share anything!", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: 'Well, the principle of sharing results applies to all departments with the capability for technological research in Babylonia, except for the Science Council.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Asimov', 3: "If there's nothing else, I'll be leaving. Members of the Control Court should also be mindful not to disturb the work of other researchers.", 4: '1'}
{3: 'Ignoring the reactions of the three, Asimov leaves directly.'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: "...That's why I hate coming back here.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: "Let's get back to the main topic.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: 'Is the World Government Association of Art looking to commercialize "Hamlet" this time?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: "Yes, the prototype has been used by Ayla. I've scaled down the technical specifications slightly to make it more suitable for mass production.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Leonie', 3: "Oh, right, I haven't asked about the specific user experience yet. Ayla also told me to pay close attention to user feedback.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: "Overall, it's pretty good. Even though I haven't tried the original, the level of immersion is far superior to other machines with virtual reality features.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lesti', 3: 'The peculiar thing is, when I was inside, I didn\'t feel at all like I was in a "machine." It felt as if, as if...', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'As if you were dreaming?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: "Exactly, when people dream, they often don't realize they're in a dream, right?", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lesti', 3: 'How did you achieve this? Did you block some kind of sensory signal?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: "Well... I'm not quite sure myself, maybe a bunch of codes just happened to simulate a similar effect?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: 'Is that something a scientist should say?!', 4: '1'}

{1: '1', 2: 'Ishmael', 3: "However, at least this won't cause any adverse side effects for the user. The specific method of technological implementation is not within the Control Court's jurisdiction.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Ishmael', 3: 'By the way, the original "Hamlet" had some magical features, didn\'t it?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: "Whatever. My only requirement is that it doesn't trigger anything similar to photosensitive epilepsy.", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: "Also, I'm not sure if it's just my imagination, but I think I saw a figure inside...?", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: 'A figure? Can you describe its features?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: 'I only remember it was a girl with black twin tails... and there seemed to be a blue flame?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lesti', 3: 'It only flashed by for an instant, so my memory is a bit fuzzy. I might have even mistaken something else for it.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: 'Black twin tails, a girl with a blue flame...', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Leonie', 3: "I don't know what exactly you're talking about, but it sounds pretty cool...!", 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: 'Was it a virtual image created by somebody?', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Leonie', 3: "No, this is a test machine. I only preloaded a few scenes from the material library, and I haven't had time to design any characters yet.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Leonie', 3: 'Could it be a bug caused by shader buffering... We might need to get more people to test it.', 4: '1'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lesti', 3: 'Right, how about inviting 【kuroname】... the Gray Raven Commandant to try it out?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lesti', 3: 'I have a feeling that person would have quite a bit of experience with this kind of thing.', 4: '1'}
{3: 'Lesti smiles, mentioning a name that everyone present is familiar with.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory462.jpg'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'The status of this area has been fully confirmed, Commandant.', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'We should meet up with Liv and Lee in about ten minutes.', 4: '1'}
{3: "Lucia, leading the way, turns to report the mission's progress."}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Is something wrong, Commandant? Are you okay?', 4: '1'}
{3: 'It was just a routine patrol mission, checking for any unusual Punishing Virus concentration at the edge of the Clean Zone.'}
{3: "You've walked this patrol route so many times that you could do it blindfolded."}
{3: 'Though it might sound odd to say, today was indeed an "ordinary" day.'}
{3: 'The only extraordinary moment might have been when you pass by a ruined building. You glance up and are momentarily blinded by the sunlight.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory00.png'}
{1: '1', 3: 'The light, refracted through the glass, is so intense that you have to squint, and for a moment, you think you see a flash of dark blue flame.'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Effect/Prefab/FxUi/FxUiStoryNew/FxUiStoryWhiteNew.prefab', 2: '3'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/Bgstory462.jpg'}
{3: 'That strange feeling lasted but a moment, and then everything returned to as normal as it could be.'}
{2: 'It might sound odd, but...', 3: '187'}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Ah... Commandant, do you feel that way too?', 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "We didn't take any breaks, and it's only been a few minutes since we split from Liv and the others...", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'But it felt like there was a moment that seemed to stretch on forever...', 4: '1'}
{2: "Yes, that's why I said it was a bit strange.", 3: '194'}
{3: 'Looking up again, all that meets your gaze are the remains of walls and the cloudless blue sky.'}
{2: 'Even though it might have been a trick of the eye...', 3: '198'}
{2: 'Maybe we should get a check-up at the Star of Life when we return...', 3: '199'}
{3: "After so many bizarre incidents, you've developed a habit of constantly checking for anything unusual with your health."}
{1: '1', 2: 'Lucia', 3: "Ah... Now that you mention it, it's been a while since I last checked on the condition of my frame.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "But, Commandant, haven't you already used up your free health check quota for this year?", 4: '1'}
{2: "No worries, I've got an annual pass.", 3: '205'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: 'Eh? When did you get that?', 4: '1'}
{2: "The last time I was in the hospital? Or the time before that... I can't quite remember.", 3: '207'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: '...Still, things have been peaceful for a while.', 4: '1'}
{2: "Yeah, so I keep feeling like I've wasted a lot of money for nothing...", 3: '210'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Well, as Liv always says, we shouldn't dwell on the negative.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "The Clean Zone has been stable lately. It'd be nice if it stays this way.", 4: '1'}
{2: 'Yes, hopefully so.', 3: '213'}
{2: 'Lucia', 3: "Let's go, Liv and Lee might be waiting for us.", 4: '1'}
{1: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgCg/Cg4001_05.jpg'}
{3: 'Atop the ruins.'}
{3: 'A girl with black hair and blue eyes stands at the edge of a steel frame, backlit by the sun.'}
{3: 'In the distance, two figures gradually recede from view.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'No matter where it is, no matter who the adversary is, the "conflict" persists...'}
{3: 'Her voice echoes in the wind as if awaiting a response.'}
{2: '???', 3: 'The battle we had...'}
{2: '???', 3: 'I thoroughly enjoyed it.'}
{1: '999', 2: 'Assets/Product/Texture/Image/BgStory/BgStory809.jpg', 3: '0', 4: '1', 5: '2'}
{3: 'The girl leaps, her clothes billowing in the gusting wind.'}
{3: 'Like a bird flapping its wings—'}
{3: 'She disappears from sight.'}
